pull.title: build: Use Link Time Optimization for Qt code on Linux
pull.body:
See: https://www.qt.io/blog/2019/01/02/qt-applications-lto

`bitcon-qt` unstripped size:
| host | master (31c6309cc60ae3fee2d3ecc2aff9576596fb98ac) | this PR, depends built with `LTO=1` |
|---|:-:|:-:|
| x86_64-pc-linux-gnu | 42 MB | 35 MB |
| arm-linux-gnueabihf | 31 MB | 26 MB |
| aarch64-linux-gnu | 41 MB | 32 MB |
| powerpc64-linux-gnu | 51 MB | 41 MB |
| powerpc64le-linux-gnu | 48 MB | 39 MB |
| riscv64-linux-gnu | 35 MB | 29 MB |

Based on the first commit from bitcoin/bitcoin#25391.

Using LTO for macOS and Windows hosts has some issues which could be addressed in follow ups.

x86_64 build:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/179326902-f91853ca-23c1-4c04-9a6d-161b695f27b5.png)

events.body: Last I checked this basically didn't work for anything other than x86_64 Linux, but if that's no-longer the case, that could be handy.

> Last I checked this basically didn't work for anything other than x86_64 Linux, but if that's no-longer the case, that could be handy.

I tthink this could be useful even if it works only for x86_64 Linux.

rename.from: build: Use Link Time Optimization for Qt code
rename.to: build: Use Link Time Optimization for Qt code on Linux

verification.payload:
tree 8962d18b75c3e3c909cc4ba18da296df8113cc5b
parent 826fae6a0fe184518af625ebb6d1ef9e64631385
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1655828206 +0100
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1657925869 +0100

build: pass -fno-lto when building expat

Otherwise it's autoconf endianess check will fail to determine what the
endianess is..

build: Use Link Time Optimization for Qt code on Linux

See: https://www.qt.io/blog/2019/01/02/qt-applications-lto

events.body:
ACK 3442865360b18b757aee718de585c31e28c457ce

I've tested this branch + #25391 + a change to allow for additional symbol exports for bitcoin-qt, and the Guix + LTO Linux builds are working.
I have not tested or run bitcoin-qt.

comments.body:
I think this could be a good starting point, assuming our configure checks also work. I haven't tested yet.
```diff
--- a/depends/packages/qt.mk
+++ b/depends/packages/qt.mk
@@ -159,6 +159,9 @@ $(package)_config_opts_x86_64_linux = -xplatform linux-clang-libc++
 else
 $(package)_config_opts_x86_64_linux = -xplatform linux-g++-64
 endif
+ifneq ($(LTO),)
+$(package)_config_opts_x86_64_linux += -ltcg
+endif
 $(package)_config_opts_aarch64_linux = -xplatform linux-aarch64-gnu-g++
 $(package)_config_opts_powerpc64_linux = -platform linux-g++ -xplatform bitcoin-linux-g++
 $(package)_config_opts_powerpc64le_linux = -platform linux-g++ -xplatform bitcoin-linux-g++
```

I think we should keep this as `$(package)_config_opts_x86_64_linux` for now. I'm still seeing build issues for all other Linux HOSTS. i.e for aarch64:
```bash
Trying source 1 (type inline) of library xcb_xinput ...
+ cd /home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/work/build/aarch64-linux-gnu/qt/5.15.3-4ca304a51a3/config.tests/xcb_xinput && PKG_CONFIG_SYSROOT_DIR=/ PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR=/home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/aarch64-linux-gnu/lib/pkgconfig /home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/work/build/aarch64-linux-gnu/qt/5.15.3-4ca304a51a3/qtbase/bin/qmake "CONFIG -= qt debug_and_release app_bundle lib_bundle" "CONFIG += static warn_off console single_arch" -early "CONFIG += cross_compile" 'QMAKE_USE += xcb_xinput' 'QMAKE_LIBS_XCB_XINPUT = -lxcb-xinput' 'QMAKE_DEPENDS_XCB_XINPUT_CC = XCB' 'QMAKE_DEPENDS_XCB_XINPUT_LD = XCB' 'QMAKE_LIBS_XCB = -L//home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/aarch64-linux-gnu/lib -lxcb' 'QMAKE_INCDIR_XCB = //home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/aarch64-linux-gnu/include' /home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/work/build/aarch64-linux-gnu/qt/5.15.3-4ca304a51a3/config.tests/xcb_xinput
+ cd /home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/work/build/aarch64-linux-gnu/qt/5.15.3-4ca304a51a3/config.tests/xcb_xinput && MAKEFLAGS= /usr/bin/gmake
> gmake[1]: Entering directory '/home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/work/build/aarch64-linux-gnu/qt/5.15.3-4ca304a51a3/config.tests/xcb_xinput'
> aarch64-linux-gnu-g++ -c -pipe -pipe -std=c++17 -flto -O2 -I/home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/aarch64-linux-gnu/include -O2 -w -fPIC  -I. -I/home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/aarch64-linux-gnu/include -I/home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/work/build/aarch64-linux-gnu/qt/5.15.3-4ca304a51a3/qtbase/mkspecs/linux-aarch64-gnu-g++ -o main.o main.cpp
> aarch64-linux-gnu-g++ -flto -L/home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/aarch64-linux-gnu/lib -Wl,-O1 -o xcb_xinput main.o   -lxcb-xinput -L//home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/aarch64-linux-gnu/lib -lxcb   
> /usr/lib/gcc-cross/aarch64-linux-gnu/11/../../../../aarch64-linux-gnu/bin/ld: cannot find -lxcb-xinput: No such file or directory
> collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
> gmake[1]: *** [Makefile:67: xcb_xinput] Error 1
> gmake[1]: Leaving directory '/home/ubuntu/bitcoin/depends/work/build/aarch64-linux-gnu/qt/5.15.3-4ca304a51a3/config.tests/xcb_xinput'
 => source failed verification.
test config.qtbase_gui.libraries.xcb_xinput FAILED
```

Changing of the `-reduce-relocations` flag dropped from this PR for now.

More details available in https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-36129
